The Chelsea Flower Show is moving online with a series of virtual exhibitions after it was cancelled. 
The Royal Horticultural Society (RHS) said this summer would mark its first ever virtual version of the event at Royal Hospital Chelsea, London. 
The show… [+1722 chars]

articles.title: William and Kate launch COVID-19 mental health scheme after being ‘left in tears’ by NHS - Mirror Online
articles.description: A Royal mental health scheme offering round-the-clock help to struggling NHS workers was set up after Kate was 'moved to tears by tales of frontline staff
articles.content:
The plight of NHS workers risking their lives on the frontline of the coronavirus battle moved Kate Middleton to tears and led her and Prince William to set up a mental health support scheme.

articles.title: Maya Jama responds to mega-money Strictly Come Dancing speculation - Mirror.co.uk
articles.description: Producers think the gorgeous star 'ticks every box' and they are keen to make the 25-year-old the jewel in 2020 Strictly crown when the show returns to our screens later this year
articles.content:
Maya Jama has broken her silence over rumours BBC bosses are eyeing her up for the next series of Strictly Come Dancing. 
Execs are said to be ready to splash out on a six figure fee to get the popular Radio 1 DJ for this years contest.

articles.content:

articles.title: Mike Tyson admits Tiger King's Joe Exotic could have sold him big cats as pets - Mirror Online
articles.description: Mike Tyson confessed he could have got his tigers indirectly from Tiger King star Joe Exotic in the early 1990s
articles.content:
Mike Tyson admitted he could have got his big cats from Tiger King star Joe Exotic.
The boxing champion, 53, splashed out his cash on three Bengal tigers as house pets at his home.
